adjective.description: Failing to act or protest as a result of moral weakness or indolence.
examples: supine in the face of racial injustice

noun.description: A Latin verbal noun used only in the accusative and ablative cases, especially to denote purpose (e.g., dictu in mirabile dictu “wonderful to relate”).

origin: Late Middle English: the adjective from Latin supinus bent backwards (related to super above); the noun from late Latin supinum, neuter of supinus.
